Latest News , News Kevin Jackson November 13, 2024 Sponsors, vendors and patrons give props to Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival It was a wholesome family affair at last Sunday’s staging of the 22nd Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival South Florida edition. Several Jamaican companies, brands and vendors displayed their products, services and food to thousands of patrons who converged at the Miramar Regional Park in Miramar to enjoy the best of what the Caribbean has to offer. Despite intermittent afternoon showers, patrons enjoyed themselves. Grace Foods is the title sponsor of the event. Andrea Reynolds, marketing manager for Grace Foods United States of American (USA), described the partnership with the event’s organisers as amicable and fruitful. Andrea Reynolds, marketing manager for Grace Foods USA (second from left) greets patrons at the Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival last Sunday at the Miramar Regional Park in South Florida. “It was another successful event, despite the rains. It has been a long-standing, amicable and fruitful partnership over the years. We were able to welcome a wide cross-section of patrons from near and far, who wanted to enjoy good food, good vibes and just to have a fun-filled day.  Vendors had the opportunity to showcase a myriad of jerk dishes… jerk shrimp, jerk chicken, jerk pork and even jerk ice cream, courtesy of Grace Jerk. We look forward to many more years to come with this partnership as we take Grace jerk across the globe,” Reynolds told Observer Online . The HTB booth located on the far-right hand side of the venue was a hit with patrons. Bread as well as bun served with cheese were sampled and there was a spin-the-wheel engagement which saw patrons winning attractive prizes. Observer Online spoke to Korie-Page Jones, export marketing manager National/HTB brands, one of the sponsors of the event. (From left) Korie-Page Jones, export marketing manager, National/HTB brands and Omega Harris, key account manager, National and HTB Portfolio hang out inside the HTB booth at the Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival. “As proud sponsors of this year’s staging of the Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival, HTB offered free HTB Giant Hardo Bread to all jerk vendors for their patrons to pair with their favourite jerk meals.  At our booth, we sampled our bread and buns to patrons, and they all left with smiles and gifts such as tumblers, tote and caps from the brand,” said Page-Jones. She added, “The HTB brand has been participating in the jerk festival for years. Each year we also highlight the Homade brand through sampling and giveaways.” Garry Hanson, operator of Maam’s Restaurant, located in Miami, participated in the jerk festival for 13 years before a one year hiatus due to an accident. He returned this year and he described the experience as good for his business. Garry Hanson, owner of Maam’s Jamaican Restaurant points in the direction of his booth at the Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival. “I do a lot of events but this one has good traffic. It’s a food festival and people are just ready to eat. At this event, they come with their appetites and I enjoy meeting different people while giving them a taste of the Jamaican flavour,” said Hanson, a native of  Portland. Shameala Matthews,  the owner of Sannicoles Little Kitchen, who migrated from Clarendon several years ago,  has been in the food business for 12 years. And this was her eighth year participating in the jerk festival. “What I enjoy most about doing this event is just seeing the happy faces after customers taste my food. That just makes my day because I love what I do,” said Matthews. Guyanese Roy Maynard, who operates B&M Bakery and a catering business, said this was his first year participating in the event. “I’ve been in business for 29 years and we do baking, fish and meat produce and take out food. I am always busy running my business and this year I decided to participate and it has been very successful, very good. I’ll definitely be here next year,” said Maynard. Rusty’s Carib Cuisine offered patrons a melting pot of jerk meals with guava and pineapple jerk sauces to add flavour. The owner, Holly Scott, a native of Jamaica, said it was her first time participating as a vendor at the festival. “This is my third time and it has been pretty good. We are giving our customers different Caribbean flavours. This is a part of what the community is about so I had to be a part of it,” she said. Sandra Morrison, who resides in West Palm Beach, travelled all the way to Miramar just to get a taste of the jerk that she has been missing out on since she migrated from Jamaica 12 years ago. “I’m from St Catherine and let me tell yuh, I had to be here. This is Jamaican, it is Caribbean, so I had to support it. The food is good and the event is very entertaining,” she disclosed. Dwayne Johnson from Fort Lauderdale concurred with Morrison. “This event is always a good showing. I enjoy the music, visiting the different booths and enjoying the different flavours and food. I even had some Grace bulla and Sorrel drink, which were really good,” he said. African American Alicia Jalaal said she was invited to the jerk festival by her Jamaican friends. “This is my first time coming here and my friends invited me. I’m actually enjoying this despite the rain,” said Jalaal. Hazel Smith has been residing in the United States for 12 years and this is her first time attending the South Florida edition of the jerk festival. “This is wonderful, I really enjoyed it. I’m here with my mother and she is also having a good time,” Smith explained. The Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival also featured a show-stopping performance by Nigy Boy, the Energy God Elephant Man, veteran reggae band Chalice, the Fantells and former Digicel Rising Stars winner, Shuga. In between sets, patrons enjoyed musical selections courtesy of Richie D, DJ Brad and DJ Stretch of Extatic Sound. About Us - Boston JerkFest 2025 Skip to content July 11th & 12th, 2025 Facebook Twitter Instagram Join our Mailing List Home Rhythm N’ Spice Festivities Festival Basics Rum and Brew Chef Demonstrations Entertainment Vendors Participate Get Tickets Become A Sponsor Become A Vendor Become A Volunteer About About Us About Jamaican Jerk About the Producer JerkFest Media Our Blog Directions & Parking Contact Contact Us Home Rhythm N’ Spice Festivities Festival Basics Rum and Brew Chef Demonstrations Entertainment Vendors Participate Get Tickets Become A Sponsor Become A Vendor Become A Volunteer About About Us About Jamaican Jerk About the Producer JerkFest Media Our Blog Directions & Parking Contact Contact Us Facebook Twitter Instagram Join our Mailing List July 11th & 12th, 2025 Home Rhythm N’ Spice Festivities Festival Basics Rum and Brew Chef Demonstrations Entertainment Vendors Participate Get Tickets Become A Sponsor Become A Vendor Become A Volunteer About About Us About Jamaican Jerk About the Producer JerkFest Media Our Blog Directions & Parking Contact Contact Us Home Rhythm N’ Spice Festivities Festival Basics Rum and Brew Chef Demonstrations Entertainment Vendors Participate Get Tickets Become A Sponsor Become A Vendor Become A Volunteer About About Us About Jamaican Jerk About the Producer JerkFest Media Our Blog Directions & Parking Contact Contact Us About Us The 12th Boston JerkFest™ is a 2-day outdoor Caribbean style foodie festival that features Jamaican jerk spiced food and all things spicy and hot to be held July 11th-12th, 2025 at Harvard Athletic Complex, 145 North Harvard Street in Allston, and just over the bridge from Harvard Square, Cambridge. This multi-day festival kicks off with a Rum & Brew Tasting Fundraiser on Friday, July 11th, 2025, 7 – 10 PM (6PM for VIP) and followed by the Boston JerkFest Festival on Saturday, July 12th, from 11 AM – 8 PM. Boston Jerkfest will feature authentic Caribbean, international, and local spicy food for sale, including: spicy meals, jams, nuts, and desserts, as well as traditional home-made drinks from the Caribbean. Boston Jerkfest also offers live music entertainment and performances for the whole family. Our Spice Lane will feature the best hot sauces in New England, as well as hot pepper value-added products. A Kids & Culture stage will offer  family-friendly performances, including the Cambridge Carnival Youth Steel Orchestra , and hands-on interactive activities. The Friday evening Rum & Brew Tasting is for 21+ festival attendees and features live music and unlimited tastings of a variety of Ca ribbean themed libations, spirits, local craft beer, wine, and artisan beverages. Our famous Cocktail Throwdown featuring rum inspired cocktails will be back again. Card To Culture We are proud to participate in the Card to Culture program, a collaboration between Mass Cultural Council and Department of Transitional Assistance , the Women, Infants & Children (WIC) Nutrition Program , and the Massachusetts Health Connector , by broadening accessibility to cultural programming. EBT, WIC, and ConnectorCare cardholders receive 1/2 off admission price to the Annual Boston JerkFest for the Saturday festival on July 12th, 2025. Children 12 and under receive free admission with an  accompanying adult. This special discount is limited to 2 adults for general admission for SATURDAY ONLY and limited to 150 tickets total available for EBT, WIC and ConnectorCare cardholders. Friday night, VIP and 2-Day passes not eligible for the discount. To access the special discount code, email us at info@bostonjerkfest.com with the subject matter: CULTURECARD and we’ll send you the link to purchase your discounted tickets. Nonprofit Partners By participating in the Boston JerkFest you are helping to support our affiliated nonprofits, Sustainable Food and Culture , Inc and the Cambridge Carnival International Cambridge Youth Steel Orchestra. Highlights of 2025 Boston JerkFest New and expanded festival footprint accommodate for more people and more vendors at Harvard Athletic Complex 9 hours of fun in the sun (extended an extra hour until 8pm) More jerk! Every restaurant vendor will offer at least one jerk dish! Spice Lane , with lots more hot stuff to keep you in the mood and the More live reggae music featuring headliner International Reggae artists to get your “Irie” on Chef demos, including a Seafood Throwdown and the Jerk Cook-off competitions, each with two chefs vying for the best jerk dish and sponsored by North American Marine Alliance, Red’s Best , and World Farmers Cocktail Throwdown featuring Boston’s hottest Mixologists who will stir up the best “Irie” drinks made from products featured at the Rum & Brew Tasting. people’s  hot sauce choice Kids & Culture stage with more family-friendly fun VIP Reggae Lounge for that extra special attention JerkFest Jamaican Rum Punch at the Reggae Bar will be on tap throughout the day Boston JerkFest T-shirts and curated Boston JerkFest Jerk Rub merchandise for sa5 2014-2025 Boston JerkFest, a production of The Williams Agency. www.thewilliamsagency.ne t site development by @trulygood

JerkFest Toronto 2025: Caribbean Food & Music Festival Returns August 8–10 • Over Here Toronto Skip to content Account Register Login Logout Instagram TikTok Facebook Email YouTube Latest Expand News Events New Launches Things To Do Expand This week Next Week Summer 2025 Fall 2025 August 2025 September 2025 October 2025 November 2025 December 2025 Best Of Expand Restaurants Cafe Bars Hotels Kid-Friendly Business Travel Events Expand Festivals 2025 Thanksgiving Halloween 2025 Add an Event TIFF 2025 View All Events Submit a Story Search Search Instagram TikTok Facebook Toggle Menu JerkFest Toronto 2025: Caribbean Food & Music Festival Returns August 8–10 Julie Anne L. May 22, 2025 19+ · 2025 · Activities · August 2025 · Events · News · Summer 2025 · Toronto Toronto, are you ready to turn up the heat? JerkFest Toronto is firing up the grill and the stage for another summer of sizzling food, dancehall rhythms, and community vibes. Mark your calendars: Friday, August 8 to Sunday, August 10, 2025, Centennial Park in Etobicoke is the place to be. Photo by DICSON on Unsplash Whether you’re here for the mouthwatering jerk chicken, high-energy performances, or just the warm island spirit, JerkFest delivers a full-on Caribbean experience — no plane ticket required. Music, Flavour, and Island Vibes This year’s headliner lineup is already making waves. Valiant, the Jamaican dancehall superstar known for viral hits like “Dunce Cheque” and “Narcissistic” , kicks things off on Friday night. He’s racked up over 290 million views on YouTube — and now, he’s bringing that energy to Toronto. Also performing is Agent Sasco (a.k.a. Assassin) — a veteran in the dancehall scene and collaborator to icons like Shaggy, Marcia Griffiths, Beres Hammond, and even Kendrick Lamar. His sets on Saturday and Sunday are guaranteed to get the crowd moving. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Jerk Festival Toronto (@jerkfestivaltoronto) Advertisement What Else Is Cooking? If you’re more of a foodie, you won’t be left behind. JerkFest isn’t just about music — it’s a Caribbean culinary showcase. Live cooking demos happen Saturday and Sunday at 1 PM, 3 PM, and 5 PM. Talented chefs will walk you through the magic behind jerk spices and traditional recipes. A chef lineup will be announced soon — so stay tuned. For a truly VIP experience, grab a ticket that includes a Caribbean meal, exclusive seating, and lounge perks. Kick Things Off on the Water Want to start the festival early? On Thursday, August 7, JerkFest sets sail with a VIP Meet & Greet Boat Cruise aboard the River Gambler. Expect: Performances from featured artists A Caribbean meal (jerk chicken, fish, or vegetarian) A cash bar and unmatched city views A party-ready crowd This 19+ cruise boards at 7:30 PM from 176 Cherry Street. Tickets are limited. Advertisement Jerkfest Toronto Ticket Options & Festival Access Photo via Jerk Festival Toronto (@jerkfestivaltoronto) • Instagram JerkFest has something for every budget and vibe: General Admission (Friday from $55.94, Saturday/Sunday from $28.25) VIP Garden (includes meals, private washrooms, front-stage access – from $169.50) Tiki Table Packages (great for families, includes 4 tickets + snacks – $90.40) Combo hotel + ticket bundles available through Marriott packages VIP and Platinum ticket holders receive meals. Security will not allow outside food or drinks, and staff will deny re-entry once you’re inside. Event Highlights at a Glance Dates: August 8–10, 2025 Location: Centennial Park , 256 Centennial Park Rd, Etobicoke (TTC accessible) Boat Cruise Kickoff: August 7 at 7:30 PM, 176 Cherry Street Performers: Valiant (Aug. 8), Agent Sasco (Aug. 9 & 10), more TBA Cooking Demos: Saturday & Sunday at 1 PM, 3 PM, and 5 PM Food Vendors & Craft Market: Open daily Cashless Policy: Tap to pay at entry and drink booths (cash still accepted at food/craft stalls) Parking: Paid parking near Hollycrest Middle School ($20 per car) Chairs & Umbrellas: Bring your own chairs. Umbrella tables are available for rent Pet Policy: Only service animals are allowed Rain or Shine: The festival goes on unless otherwise announced How to Enter the Spotlight Got talent? Enter the “Show Your Flow” competition for a chance to perform live at JerkFest 2025 and win a cash prize. Submit your R&B, Soca, Reggae, Dancehall, Hip-Hop, Afrobeat, or Gospel performance online. Plan Your Visit at Jerkfest Toronto Website: www.jerkfestival.ca Tickets: Available online. We offer a range of different roles, depending on the needs of our partners. At events , our most common roles include box office, stewarding, hospitality and customer service roles. Our non event roles range from front of house, barista, catering and logistics positions. Have a look at our events pages to see what roles suit your skills, interests and availability best. What sectors do you support? Ethical Staffing work with a hugely diverse range of clients; Conferences, Sporting Events, Brand activations, World Heritage events, University Graduations, and of course, Live Events and Festivals. We are proud to state that our client portfolio is as diverse as our staffing teams! What is the application process? Want to join our superstar team? First you’ll need to fill out an application form on our recruitment portal. Here you can tell us about your experience & what events you’re interested in. One of our recruitment team will then arrange to have a telephone or Zoom interview with you, and if successful we will set you up on our shift allocation system where you will be able to choose any roles that you are interested in working at, and be the first to find out about exciting new openings! Learn more here. Can I work with my friends? Absolutely! The more the merrier! We can’t guarantee that your shifts / roles will align, but we can do our very best to make it work. Please ensure you mention this when you are contacted by our team at HQ to book in your work. What's in it for me? We truly take pride in supporting our your wellbeing and happiness! At an event, this includes free tea and coffee, snacks and around the clock support from our awesome team of managers. For weekend camping events you will also get perks like a free meal ticket for each shift worked, access to a dedicated crew camping area with hot showers, phone charging points and lots more! “Just wanted to say thanks to you and the team for today. The 21st Annual Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival | November 12th, 2023 JaSupreme April 1, 2023 Concert Series , Concert/Festivals News , Concerts , Festivals , Food FOOD AND MUSIC HEADLINE THE 21ST ANNUAL GRACE JAMAICAN JERK FESTIVAL WITH PERFORMANCES BY MORGAN HERITAGE, DING DONG, COLLIE BUDDZ AND CELEBRITY CHEFS FROM ALL OVER THE CARIBBEAN Popular Caribbean food festival returns Sunday November 12th to Miramar Regional Park Miramar, FL (October 18, 2023) – The 21st Annual Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival (GJJF), happening on Sunday, November 12, 2023 from 1pm-10 pm at Miramar Regional Park, located at 16801 Miramar Pkwy, Miramar, Fl 33027, has announced its sizzling all-star lineup of chefs and musical performers. The Publix Culinary Pavilion will feature Internationally acclaimed celebrity chefs Travis Reece (Jamaica), Jamal Small (Bahamas) and Darian Bryan (Jamaica), while on the musical side, two-time Grammy-winning Royal Family of Reggae Morgan Heritage, Jamaican dancehall sensation Ding Dong and straight out of Bermuda, reggae artist Collie Buddz, will provide the soundtrack and vibes for a day filled with fun, food and Caribbean culture. Turning up the heat in the Chef Challenge is the 2022 champion, NBC-6’s Cherney Amhara, who is being challenged this year by WPLG’s Alexis Frazier for the honor GJJF’s 2023 Top Chef award. Celebrity judges include Jamaica Food Boss and South Florida based Hungry Black Man Additional entertainment will feature comedian Chris “Johnny” Daley, Dancin’ Dynamites 2003 winners from Jamaica, DJs Richie D, Jazzy T, DJ Radcliffe and Ecstatic Sound along with a Patty Eating Contest with a $1,000 prize! Emcees are Jody Ann Gray and Tanto Irie of Hot105 FM. From succulent jerk chicken to tender jerk lobster, GJJF serves up an authentic culinary journey through the heart of the islands. The festival features an exciting food court offering a wide assortment of cuisines such as jerk chicken, pork, and fish, along with Jamaican favorites fried festival, oxtails, curry goat, escovitch fish, roasted corn, as well as other tasty delights. GJJF Managing Partner and CEO Eddy Edwards commented “South Florida is home to the largest Caribbean population in the United States. The Grace Jamaican Jerk Festival reminds us of the significant, positive and delicious impact the Caribbean has on the American culture. Over the past 21 years, the festival has evolved to incorporate other wonderful Caribbean cultures, such as the Bahamas, and attract people the world over”. GJJF presented by Publix in partnership with City of Miramar, Western Union, Greater Ft. Lauderdale Visitors and Conventions Bureau, The National Weekly, Jamaica Observer, WAVS 1170 AM, Cox Radio Miami, and for the first time ever, the top stations in the Bahamas Star 106.5 and HOT 91.7 along the Nassau Guardian to welcome attendees from Islands of the Bahamas to enjoy some South Florida style island culture. General admission tickets are $40 and $50 at the gate on event day. VIP tickets are $175. Kids under 10 are free to attend. To purchase tickets and for more information, visit www.jerkfestival.com Media contact: Suzan McDowell, suzan@circleofonemarketing.com or 305-576-3790 –MEDIA IMAGES About Jamaican Jerk Festival USA, Inc. : The Jamaican Jerk Festival USA, Inc. develops and produces Jerk festivals and related events throughout the United States and other global markets. The annual festivals in Miramar, Florida, and Queens, New York, are major events attracting all ethnicities and key demographics.
